post.summary:
tapcli: `rfq buyoffer`
AddAssetBuyOffer is used to add a buy offer for a specific asset. If a
buy offer already exists for the asset, it will be updated.
post.description:
A buy offer is used by the node to selectively accept or reject incoming
asset sell quote requests before price is considered.

parameters.name: asset_specifier.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

post.summary: SubscribeRfqEventNtfns is used to subscribe to RFQ events.

get.summary:
tapcli: `rfq acceptedquotes`
QueryPeerAcceptedQuotes is used to query for quotes that were requested by
our node and have been accepted our peers.

post.summary:
tapcli: `rfq selloffer`
AddAssetSellOffer is used to add a sell offer for a specific asset. If a
sell offer already exists for the asset, it will be updated.

parameters.name: asset_specifier.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

post.summary:
tapcli: `rfq selloffer`
AddAssetSellOffer is used to add a sell offer for a specific asset. If a
sell offer already exists for the asset, it will be updated.

parameters.name: asset_specifier.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

post.summary:
tapcli: `rfq sellorder`
AddAssetSellOrder is used to add a sell order for a specific asset. If a
sell order already exists for the asset, it will be updated.

parameters.name: asset_specifier.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

post.summary:
tapcli: `rfq sellorder`
AddAssetSellOrder is used to add a sell order for a specific asset. If a
sell order already exists for the asset, it will be updated.

parameters.name: asset_specifier.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

scid.description:
scid is the short channel ID of the channel over which the payment for
the quote is made.

max_units.description: max_units is the maximum amount of the asset to buy.

min_asset_amount.description: The minimum amount of the asset to buy.

max_bid.description: The maximum amount BTC to spend (units: millisats).

expiry.description: The unix timestamp in seconds after which the order is no longer valid.

peer_pub_key.description:
peer_pub_key is an optional field for specifying the public key of the
intended recipient peer for the order.

timeout_seconds.description:
timeout_seconds is the number of seconds to wait for the peer to respond
with an accepted quote (or a rejection).

accepted_quote.description:
accepted_quote holds the quote received from the peer as a response
to our quote request.

invalid_quote.description:
invalid_quote is returned if the quote response received from the
peer was invalid or insufficient.

rejected_quote.description:
rejected_quote is returned if the quote request was rejected by the
peer.

max_units.description: max_units is the maximum amount of the asset to sell.

max_asset_amount.description: The maximum amount of the asset to sell.

min_ask.description: The minimum amount of BTC to accept (units: millisats).

expiry.description: The unix timestamp in seconds after which the order is no longer valid.

peer_pub_key.description:
peer_pub_key is an optional field for specifying the public key of the
intended recipient peer for the order.

timeout_seconds.description:
timeout_seconds is the number of seconds to wait for the peer to respond
with an accepted quote (or a rejection).

accepted_quote.description:
accepted_quote holds the quote received from the peer as a response
to our quote request.

invalid_quote.description:
invalid_quote is returned if the quote response received from the
peer was invalid or insufficient.

rejected_quote.description:
rejected_quote is returned if the quote request was rejected by the
peer.

asset_id.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

asset_id_str.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

group_key.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

group_key_str.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

status.description: status is the status of the quote response.

peer.description: peer is the quote counterparty peer.

id.description: id is the unique identifier of the quote request.

rfqrpcInvalidQuoteResponse.description:
InvalidQuoteResponse is a message that is returned when a quote response is
invalid or insufficient.

id.description: The unique identifier of the quote request.

scid.description:
scid is the short channel ID of the channel over which the payment for
the quote should be made.

asset_amount.description: asset_amount is the amount of the subject asset.

ask_price.description: ask_price is the price in milli-satoshi per asset unit.

expiry.description: The unix timestamp in seconds after which the quote is no longer valid.

peer_accepted_buy_quote.description: The asset buy quote that was accepted by out peer.

id.description: The unique identifier of the quote request.

scid.description:
scid is the short channel ID of the channel over which the payment for
the quote should be made.

asset_amount.description: asset_amount is the amount of the subject asset.

bid_price.description: bid_price is the price in milli-satoshi per asset unit.

expiry.description: The unix timestamp in seconds after which the quote is no longer valid.

peer_accepted_sell_quote.description: The asset sell quote that was accepted by out peer.

buy_quotes.description:
buy_quotes is a list of asset buy quotes which were requested by our
node and have been accepted by our peers.

sell_quotes.description:
sell_quotes is a list of asset sell quotes which were requested by our
node and have been accepted by our peers.

rfqrpcQuoteRespStatus.description:
QuoteRespStatus is an enum that represents the status of a quote response.

 - INVALID_RATE_TICK: INVALID_RATE_TICK indicates that the rate tick in the quote response is
invalid.
 - INVALID_EXPIRY: INVALID_EXPIRY indicates that the expiry in the quote response is
invalid.
 - PRICE_ORACLE_QUERY_ERR: PRICE_ORACLE_QUERY_ERR indicates that an error occurred when querying the
price oracle whilst evaluating the quote response.

peer.description: peer is the quote counterparty peer.

id.description: id is the unique identifier of the quote request.

error_message.description: error_message is a human-readable error message.

error_code.description: error_code is a machine-readable error code.

rfqrpcRejectedQuoteResponse.description:
RejectedQuoteResponse is a message that is returned when a quote request is
rejected by the peer.

peer_accepted_buy_quote.description:
peer_accepted_buy_quote is an event that is emitted when a peer
accepted (incoming) asset buy quote message is received.

peer_accepted_sell_quote.description:
peer_accepted_sell_offer is an event that is emitted when a peer
accepted (incoming) asset sell quote message is received.

accept_htlc.description:
accept_htlc is an event that is sent when a HTLC is accepted by the
RFQ service.
